Cardioversion of AF
Meta-analysis of 13 randomized studies reported that amiodarone was superior to placebo for cardioversion of recent-onset AF, but the time to conversion was delayed for >6 h (Relative Risk, RR 1.23) . Whereas amiodarone was less effective than class IC drugs within the first 8 h (RR 0.67), its efficacy was similar to class IC agents 24 h following drug administration (RR 0.95) .
